title: Bobby Duncum Sr.
text:
Bobby Edward Duncum Sr. (born August 14, 1944) is an <a href="Americans">American</a> former <a href="professional%20wrestler">professional wrestler</a> from the late 1960s to late 1980s, performing for the <a href="World%20Wide%20Wrestling%20Federation">World Wide Wrestling Federation</a>, <a href="National%20Wrestling%20Alliance">National Wrestling Alliance</a> and <a href="American%20Wrestling%20Association">American Wrestling Association</a>. He is the father of the late wrestler <a href="Bobby%20Duncum%20Jr.">Bobby Duncum Jr.</a>. 
American football career.
Duncum was a three-year <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">letterman</a> with the <a href="West%20Texas%20A%26amp%3BM%20Buffaloes">West Texas A&M Buffaloes</a> <a href="American%20football">football</a> team from 1964 to 1966. He was selected by the <a href="Arizona%20Cardinals">St. Louis Cardinals</a> in the thirteenth round (331st overall) of the <a href="1967%20NFL/AFL%20Draft">1967 NFL/AFL Draft</a>. He appeared in only four games with the Cardinals in <a href="1968%20St.%20Louis%20Cardinals%20%28NFL%29%20season">1968</a>.
Professional wrestling career.
His wrestling persona was that of a <a href="heel%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">heel</a> cowboy and he wrestled some of the top <a href="face%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">babyface</a> stars of the era such as <a href="Bob%20Backlund">Bob Backlund</a> and <a href="Bruno%20Sammartino">Bruno Sammartino</a>. In the AWA, along with <a href="Nick%20Bockwinkel">Nick Bockwinkel</a>, <a href="Ray%20Stevens%20%28wrestler%29">Ray Stevens</a> and <a href="Blackjack%20Lanza">Blackjack Lanza</a>, he was a member of famous wrestling stable, managed by <a href="Bobby%20Heenan">Bobby Heenan</a>, known as <a href="The%20Heenan%20Family">The Heenan Family</a>. His famous catch phrase during interviews (and written phonetically) was "You unnastan?" ("you understand?"). His final match was on November 16, 1986, in Clarksburg, West Virginia, where he tag teamed with <a href="Lord%20Zoltan">Lord Zoltan</a> to defeat <a href="Shane%20Douglas">Troy Orndorff</a> and Kurt Kaufman.
